entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HIGH SURF FOR THE KUSKOKWIM BAY COAST SUNDAY... An upper level disturbance will promote enhanced west to southwesterly winds early Sunday into Sunday afternoon. entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Sunday Night Through Monday... North to northwest winds will increase Sunday night into Monday, resulting in elevated surf. Waves will wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:43PM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued August 06 at 2:38PM AKDT until August 07 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected above 3000 feet, with 1 to 2 inches from 2000 to 3000 feet.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 8:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY... An atmospheric river is affecting the northern half of Southeast Alaska. As of 8 AM Saturday, Yakutat and Juneau have measured 1-2 inches of rain, while Sitka and Pelican measured 2-3 inches. A wave in the front will cause a resurgence of rainfall rates Saturday afternoon with an additional 0.5-1.5 inches expected.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:46PM CDT by NWS
